main.name: Daniel Song
main.description: I'm Daniel Song, a Software Engineer from Mason, OH. I just recently graduated from Duke University, where I studied Computer Science and Biology. Go Blue Devils!
main.bio: I am analytical, creative, and a quick learner! I welcome a challenge and enjoy solving complex problems. I am a flexible worker in team scenarios and I also work well independently. Above all, I believe I bring a warm and friendly presence wherever I am.
main.contactmessage: Here is where you should write your message to readers to have them get in contact with you.

resume.skillmessage: My experience with various languages and technologies:

education.description: Data Structures and Algorithms, Computer Architecture, Operating Systems, Computational Genomics, Discrete Math, Design and Analysis of Algorithms

work.title: Software Developer Intern
description: I worked on an Agile team and developed RESTful API with React Native frontend and Node.js/MongoDB backend. I was also the team's DevOps engineer, Dockerizing our app and deploying our API/Database to OpenShift. Our team won first place in the Final Sharktank Competition after we presented our app to partnering physicians.

work.title: Research Assistant
work.description: I helped research how the lack of a gene translates to different heart cells and increased heart failure. We published a paper:

projects.title: Canadian Wanderlust
projects.category: My Travel Blog for my post-university travels

projects.title: Fury Fighting Gear
projects.category: (offline now) A fighting gear company I started

projects.title: Original Thai Food
projects.category: Website I built for a restaurant I like in Thailand

testimonials.text: Here you should write some nice things that someone has said about you. No lies though, employers can tell when you are lying.

That Tim Baker must be one of the most brilliant developers I've ever met! It is amazing that nobody has hired him yet. Hey you, you should hire this guy, he may be fresh out of University and have zero on the job experience but I am confident that he will be one of your best developers in no time!
